I think the fully enchanted armor drops can be balanced out by making the armor have the effect, "Curse of Vanishing" - which means that while the gear would be OP, it would be destroyed upon death requiring care if you want to keep your spoils for very long. Especially if the Yeti hunts in pairs, with the mate hanging back, stalking, and then striking if and when the time is right. Such as while you are busy celebrating victory or if you happen to run in it's direction. In that case, each yeti would drop gear than compliments the other's, so if you got a head and chest item from you you'd be sure to get the pants and shoes from the other - if you can. Of course, all 4 items would have curse of vanishing.

Give a Horse the ability to equip an elytra like you equip a saddle. The horse gains the ability to fly, it becomes a pegasus. To differ from usual elytra use, you do not need rockets to propel you forward. The horse flies using its own stamina. The already used jumpbar (when you prepare to jump with a horse, it loads a bar to control your jump) can be used as a stamina bar. The horse would be able to hover without losing stamina. Flight with a horse would be easier to control and smoother over all, you are able to hover in places, it uses stamina instead of rockets. Flight with a personal equipped elytra would be faster, you are able to carry a lot of rockets with you, thus being able to travel farther, without resting. Using a horse for small to medium flight distances, within or inbetween bases, and using normal elytra for far away destinations. Both ways of flying would be unique and have its own advantages. Furthermore horses would gain a late game relevance, which they are lacking atm.

I would rather see pegasi just added in a new fantasy dimension

Great idea, as horses are currently useless after you get Elytra, which is really unfortunate. Both should have a use... 

Advantages of Pegasus over Elytra:

  • Pegasus should be able to hover (bobbing up/down with wing flaps to make aiming a bow very difficult so it's not OP). 
  • Pegasus should have additional storage for a speed/jump penalty (maybe donkey gets double chest storage w/ no penalty). This extra space will be needed as more items are added to the game, making Ender/Shulker storage insufficient.
  • Can easily transition to riding on land, which is very fast and requires no extra fuel (perhaps normal flight for a horse should require additional food). (Ideally Frost-Walker boots would also allow travel across water for added versatility.)

Advantages of Elytra over Pegasus:

  • Faster.
  • Tighter/faster turning.
  • No mounting/dismounting.

The one other thing that may be needed for making this a viable transportation option is the ability to store the animal (or other animals) in a kind of ~Poke-ball. Otherwise, you'll inevitably get the hassle of having to go back to retrieve the Pegasus, which will dis-incentivize use. (Maybe Eye-of-Ender surrounded by eggs in a crafting table, throw at animal to capture, durability = health, throw again to deploy; I think there are mods like this...)

Lets add a Pegasus or a Magic Saddle

What if we give an enchanted apple and a netherite block to a skeleton horse and watch it turn into a pegasus? To make it fly we would have to feed it emeralds or amethysts and it cannot die.

Another good idea is having a magic saddle, which allows you to mount and ride any mob, and if you put it on a horse, it turns the horse into a flying horse (pegasus). Made with a normal saddle, eye of ender, and a netherite block .

One more idea: Normal horses are basically useless for exploring over water. What if you can put a new enchantment on a trident, that allows mobs within 100 blocks to not drown while you or an armor stand hold it and allows you to ride a horse in the sea( names I came up with for enchantment: king of the sea, seahorse , undrowning) another simple fix could be adding these as separate enchantments for horse armor or saddles.

I think these additions would make the game a lot more fun and may attract attention from nubes and people who have gotten bored over the years. Feel free to comment any ideas or suggestions.
